thread.title: Two thoughtful letter-writers: iPhones aren’t a substitute for life
thread.title_full: Two thoughtful letter-writers: iPhones aren’t a substitute for life

author: Omar L. Gallaga
title: Two thoughtful letter-writers: iPhones aren’t a substitute for life
text:
Two thoughtful letter-writers: iPhones aren’t a substitute for life 12:00 a.m. Monday, Sept. 21, 2015 | Filed in: Technology ﻿ Story Highlights New editions of Apple’s best-selling iPhones — the iPhone 6S and 6S Plus — debut in stores Friday. Two readers say they’ve witnessed people ignoring the world, buried in their smartphones. It’s up to us to make the world around us more engaging than what’s on a smartphone screen. 
On Friday, the new models of Apple’s iPhone — the iPhone 6S and the larger 6S Plus — will land in the hands of shoppers who are upgrading or in some cases switching to a smartphone for the first time. 
It’s the ninth time Apple has had a launch day for iPhones. By now the process is more than familiar. The preorder period, the instant-gratification seekers who’ll stand in line the morning of, the breathless reviews, which typically include very minor criticisms. It’s all very routine.
